instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..

threads.title: Greet light IS present on charger. *No boot.  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[B]Hi![/B]

[B]Green light IS present on charger. No boot.[/B]

[B]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>[/B]

[B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B[/B]


[B]No 3 volt rails present[/B]


[B]<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is present at <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>[/B]

[B]<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> not present [/B]

[B]<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> has resistance of only 2.5Ω to ground so it’s shorted right? Replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?[/B]


[B]Thank you!![/B]

threads.title: Greet light IS present on charger. *No boot.  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I will remove <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> first.
If still short, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is fried for sure.
